title.value: Pruning Sparse Tensor Neural Networks Enables Deep Learning for D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy
title.justification: The title is clearly indicated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Pruning Sparse Tensor Neural Networks Enables Deep Learning for 3D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy

extractions.description: This paper explores the application of Sparse Tensor Neural Networks to reduce memory usage and enhance performance in 3D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy (ULM). The study extends deep learning architectures from 2D to 3D imaging, achieving significant memory reductions and performance improvements in high microbubble concentration settings.

type.justification: The paper conducts various experiments to test the effectiveness of Sparse Tensor Neural Networks in 3D ULM, addressing memory usage and performance.
type.quote: In this work, we studied the impact of using a sparse formulation on the memory usage and performance of Deep-stULM.

primary_research_field.justification: The focus of the paper is on the application of deep learning techniques to improve 3D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy.
primary_research_field.quote: Index Termsâ€”Deep Learning, 3D imaging, Ultrasound Localization Microscopy (ULM), Sparse Tensor Neural Networks

sub_research_fields.justification: The paper applies deep learning models to medical imaging, specifically Ultrasound Localization Microscopy.
sub_research_fields.quote: Ultrasound Localization Microscopy (ULM) is a non-invasive technique that allows for the imaging of microvessels in vivo.

name.justification: The primary model investigated in the paper is the Sparse Tensor Neural Networks.
name.quote: To improve the scaling of memory complexity of deep learning approaches in ULM, we propose to leverage the recently introduced Sparse Tensor Neural Networks.

caracteristics.justification: The study leverages Sparse Tensor Neural Networks to address memory and performance challenges.
caracteristics.quote: We show that Sparse Tensor Neural Networks reduce memory cost and scale better with added input dimensions, which allows for the training of 3D ULM models with a limited impact on the performance when compared to dense architectures.

name.justification: The dataset used is indicated to be simulated using the SIMUS framework.
name.quote: The ultrasound signal corresponding to the microbubble position was simulated using an in-house GPU implementation of SIMUS [28] with parameters corresponding to an L22-14 probe (Vermon, Tours).

name.justification: The Python library MinkowskiEngine was used for implementing Sparse Tensor Neural Networks.
name.quote: After the dense-to-sparse operation, the sparse tensor containing the low-resolution signal was given as input to a Sparse Tensor Neural Network implemented using the Python library MinkowskiEngine [25].
